conclusion: Calculate the speed of the block at point B and determine the ratio of the supporting force to the gravitational force at point B.
Mechanical energy of the block is conserved when moving from point A to point B.
Equation mgR = 1/2 m v_B^2 is set up using energy conservation principle.
Calculate v_B: v_B = sqrt(2 * 10 * 0.8) = sqrt(16) = 4 m/s.
At point B, centripetal force is provided by the difference between supporting force F_N and gravitational force.
Equation F_N - mg = m v_B^2/R is set up for centripetal force calculation.
Substitute v_B into centripetal force equation: F_N - mg = m 16/0.8 = 20m.
Calculate the ratio of supporting force to gravitational force: F_N/mg = 30m/10m = 3.
Final answer: Speed of block at point B is 4 m/s, ratio of supporting force to gravitational force is 3.
